The Iran–Israel War started on 13 June 2025, when Israel launched several airstrikes against Iranian nuclear facilities and assassinated key Iranian military officials including the head of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) Hossein Salami and the leader of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Aerospace Force Amir Ali Hajizadeh. This operation was nicknamed "Operation Rising Lion". These strikes in Iran killed over 78 people and injured 320. Then on 13 June, Iran responded with sending missiles towards Israel injuring 40 people and killing 1.
Timeline
13 June
Israel striked Iran in an operation nicknamed Operation Roaring Lion In the early hours of 13 June 2025, it targeted the Nuclear program of Iran, saying the purpose of the strikes was to prevent Iran's rapid progress in developing a nuclear weapon. The Israeli Air Force also killed Hossein Salami who was the head of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. They also killed the chief of staff of the Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces Mohammad Bagherii, Ali Shamkhani who is a close aid to Ali Khamenei and Ali Hajizade who is the commander of the IRGC Aerospace Force. 78 people were killed in this attack including 320 who were injured.
Iran started their attacks against Israel on this day which was code named Operation True Promise 3 which included a wave of missiles and a high-rise building was hit by one of the missiles. Which damaged the lower third of the structure which is in a densely populated urban area, and a apartment block by Ramat Gan was also destroyed. Israel said that 34 people were injured and one person died.
